2.2 Matrices 25
Example 2.4 (Inverse Matrix)
The matrices
A=


1 2 1
4 4 5
6 7 7

, B=


−7 −7 6
2 1 −1
4 5 −4

 (2.25)
are inverse to each other since AB= I= BA.
Deﬁnition 2.4 (Transpose). For A∈Rm×n the matrix B ∈Rn×m with
bij = aji is called the transpose of A. We write B= A⊤. transpose
The main diagonal
(sometimes called
“principal diagonal”,
“primary diagonal”,
“leading diagonal”,
or “major diagonal”)
of a matrix Ais the
collection of entries
Aij where i= j.
